results.title: Nous N'irons Plus Au Bois = We Will Not Enter the Forest
results.creator_credit: Catherine Winter, Gisele Rebillon and Georges Dumoulin
results.brief_description:
During Summer 1944, a group of young people takes to the woods with orders to keep guard on four German deserters. However, Lise, a liaison agent starts a romance with Werner, one of the prisonners.

Credits: Producers, Gisele Rebillon, Catherine Winter ; director, Georges Dumoulin ; writer, Catherine Varlin ; photography, Alain Derobe ; music, Michel Sendrez.
Cast: Marie-France Pisier, Siegfried Rauch, Richard Leduc, Jacques Higelin, Jacques Masson, Siegfried Rauch, Sylvain Joubert, Georges Rouquier.

results.title: Nous les Jericho = Sacre Grand-Pere = Dear Old Grandpa
results.brief_description:
Jericho is a retired veterinarian who lives on a property in Provence. He invites his grandson and his wife to spend the holidays. Although Marie and Jacques are about to divorce, they agree to disguise it in order to spare Jericho’s feelings. Jericho knows better, and realising that the couple is estranged, slyly works to bring about a reconciliation.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Laurent ; director, Jacques Poitrenaud ; writers, Jacques Poitrenaud, Albert Cossery, Maria Suire ; photography, Jean-Marc Ripert ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Michel Simon, Marie Dubois, Thalie Fruges, Serge Gainsbourg, Jeanne Helia, Yves Lefebvre, Mary Marquet.

results.title: Nous les Gosses = Us Kids
results.brief_description:
A group of schoolchildren decide to work during their holidays in order to pay for a large glass window they have broken while playing soccer in the schoolyard. But their treasure is under threat. Filmed during the Occupation, this ‘poetic realist’ film extolls the virtues of solidarity and mateship inherited from the Popular Front era.

Credits: Producer, Jean Faurez ; director, Louis Daquin ; writers, Gaston Modot, Maurice Hilero, Marcel Ayme ; photography, Jean Bachelet ; music, Marius-Francois Gaillard ; art direction, Lucien Aguettand ; editor, Suzanne de Troeyes.
Cast: Louise Carletti, Gilbert Gil, Pierre Larquey, Louis Seigner, Andre Brunot, Raymond Bussieres, Emile Genevois, Paul Frankeur.

results.title: Notting Hill
results.creator_credit: Duncan Kenworthy, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment and Roger Mitchell
results.brief_description: Hugh Grant plays William Thacker, owner of a travel bookstore in London’s Notting Hill. A chance visit to his store by famous American movie star, Anna Scott, played by Julia Roberts, sparks a complicated romance between the two. The worlds of celebrity and everyday people in collision creates a series of misunderstandings and dilemmas which divide and reunite the pair on more than one occasion. In an adventurous finale William rallies his ensemble of old friends and a mad flatmate to try one last time to get the girl. A British romantic comedy from the makers of “Four Weddings and a Funeral”. Cast also includes Hugh Bonneville, Emma Chambers and James Dreyfus.

results.title: Notorious Hope Diamond
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Duroux, Barry Stoner and Stoner Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Treasures of the world”.
A detailed documentary on the unique Hope Diamond, examining the 350 year human history of this notorious jewel, and the rumored curse which struck those who came into contact with it. The history of the stone began in the seventeenth century when French merchant, Jean-Battiste Tavernier - travelling the world in search of exotic jewels - purchased a 112 carat diamond coloured an exquisite shade of blue. Tavernier sold this stone to King Louis XIV of France in 1668, who ordered it to be recut, and wore it on ceremonial occasions suspended from a ribbon. The “French Blue”, as it was now known, was reset again in 1749 for King Louis XV. During the French Revolution, the diamond was stolen during the looting of the crown jewels, and disappeared for several years before surfacing in the gem collection catalog of Henry John Hope, from whom the diamond takes its name. Following his death in 1839, the diamond passed through many hands, finally being bought by famed jeweler Pierre Cartier in 1909. Cartier showed the Hope Diamond to Mrs Evalyn Walsh McLean, an eccentric but wealthy patron, in 1910, but she disliked the setting, so Cartier had it reset, and offered it to her again. Mrs. McLean finally bought the stone, eventually having it reset as a pendant on a diamond necklace. Mrs. McLean wore the Hope diamond as a good luck charm, but was not immune from the alleged curse; her nine year old son was killed, her husband left her for another woman, the family newspaper went bankrupt, and her daughter overdosed on sleeping pills. After Mrs McLean’s death in 1947, her jewelry was sold to Harry Wintston Inc., who took the Hope diamond and sent it on a nine year goodwill tour to raise money for charitable events. Eventually, Winston donated the Hope diamond to the Smithsonian Institute’s gem collection, where it can still be seen today.

results.brief_description: A compelling drama about human relationships, fidelity, betrayal and guilt. Cary Grant plays Devlin, a secret service agent. Ingrid Bergman plays Alicia, the daughter of a convicted traitor whom Devlin enlists in a scheme to investigate the activities of surviving, post-war Nazis in Brazil.

results.title: Nothing sacred
results.creator_credit: David O. Selznick, Selznick International Pictures and William Wellman
results.brief_description: Carol Lombard is hilariously funny playing the role of Hazel Flagg in this outstanding black comedy. Hazel’s bumbling doctor mistakenly diagnoses her as having fatal radium poisoning. Although she’s never felt better, Hazel pretends to be dying in order to accept the offer of an all-expenses-paid visit to New York City made by a newspaper reporter. By the time the reporter begins churning out daily reports of the tragedy, half of Manhattan is in tears and Hazel is built up to be a brave ‘suffering in silence’ charmer and is lionized by the media and public. When Hazel cannot disguise her good health any longer, a group of her financial backers wise up to her ruse and ask her to find a way to die and save them all further embarassment.This was one of the first screwball comedies ever produced, and possibly one of the finest.
